We need to keep this momentum going. The Govt. has gotten away with impunity for its undemocratic and repressive actions for too long. Register your protest NOW and keep at it. Take the day off from work. Show up for all protests that you can. Democracy is seriously worth it.

However, the mass public resistance against #CAA gives hope in these dark times. Protests are being spontaneously organised in all major towns and cities in the country over multiple days. And the public discourse on the issue on social media has been exceptionally vigourous.

The #CAA protects non-muslims from statelessness, in a situation of failure to prove their citizenship in an NRC exercise. Where as, Muslims, given the Govt.'s ideological leanings and power, are extremely vulnerable to being regarded as illegal citizens.

With the #CAA and the #NRC, the Govt. has successfully come up with an institutionalised mechanism to persecute Muslims in India. How, you ask? The burden of proving citizenship will lie with the citizens, with the state having  absolute control over the process.

The Personal Data Protection (PDP) Bill that was recently tabled in the Lok Sabha, if passed, will allow the Govt. to  access private data on grounds of sovereignty or public order. This has dangerous implications, and can be used to implicate dissenting voices.

India's already ranked 140th of out 180 countries in terms of press freedom, & the Govt's plans to further curb this freedom with its draft Registration of Press and Periodical (RPP) Bill, 2019, requiring publishers of news on Digital Media shall register themselves with the Gov.

Abrogation of article 370, the Transgender Persons bill, the #NRC, the #CAA, the UAPA, internet shut downs, were some anti-democracy steps taken by this government only in the first few months since it's re-election. One can only imagine what's in store for the next 4 years.
